resources.string: Hi this is the quiz app
Sri Lanka gained independence in the year: 1948.
The supreme law of Sri Lanka is its Constitution, adopted in: 1978.
The Constitution of Sri Lanka has amendments.
The fundamental rights enshrined in the Constitution of Sri Lanka include the right to: Freedom of Speech.
Freedom of religion in Sri Lanka ensures: Citizens must follow the state religion.
In Sri Lanka, the President is a key part of the: Legislative branch.
Who is responsible for making laws at the national level in Sri Lanka? The President.
The Parliament of Sri Lanka consists of how many members? 225.
